post.description: Generate a URL for the browser to render to kick off OAuth flow.

providerWorkspaceRef.description: The identifier for the provider workspace (e.g. the Salesforce subdomain).

value.description: The value of the metadata field

source.description: The source of the metadata field

displayName.description: The human-readable name for the field

groupRef.description: The ID that your app uses to identify the group of users for this Connection, this can be an Org ID, workspace ID, etc.

groupName.description: The display name for the group. Defaults to groupRef if not provided.

consumerRef.description: The ID that your app uses to identify the user whose SaaS credential will be used for this OAuth flow.

consumerName.description: The display name for the consumer. Defaults to consumerRef if not provided.

providerAppId.description: ID of the provider app, returned from a CreateProviderApp call. If omitted, the default provider app that was set up on the Ampersand Dashboard is assumed.

provider.description: The provider that this app connects to.

allOf.title: Problem
allOf.description:
A Problem Details object (RFC 9457).

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

supportPhone.description: A phone number to contact for support

supportUrl.description: A URL to contact for support

retryable.description: Whether the request can be retried

retryAfter.description: A timestamp after which the request can be retried, formatted as RFC-3339

If always, the integration will subscribe to association change events.

items.description: Non-standard events that the integration will subscribe to.

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem

allFieldsMetadata.description: This is a map of all fields on the object including their metadata (such as display name and type), the keys of the map are the field names.

providerType.description: Raw field type from the provider API.

values.description: If the valueType is singleSelect or multiSelect, this is a list of possible values

items.title: Field Value
items.description: Represents a field value

value.description: The internal value used by the system

allFields.description: This is a list of all fields on the object for a particular SaaS instance, including their display names. Prefer using allFieldsMetadata instead.

mapToName.description: The field name to map to in the destination.

mapToDisplayName.description: The display name to map to in the destination.

days.description: Number of days in past to backfill from. 0 is no backfill. e.g) if 10, then backfill last 10 days of data. Required if fullHistory is not set.

fullHistory.description: If true, backfill all history. Required if days is not set.

valueDefaults.title: Value Defaults
valueDefaults.description: Configuration to set default write values for object fields.

allowAnyFields.description: If true, users can set default values for any field.

parameters.name: projectIdOrName
parameters.description: The Ampersand project ID or project name.

parameters.name: groupRef
parameters.description: The ID of the user group that has access to this installation.

groupRef.description: The ID of the user group that has access to this installation.

groupName.description: The name of the user group that has access to this installation.

createTime.description: The time the group was created.

updateTime.description: The time the group was last updated.

healthStatus.description: The health status of the installation ("healthy", "unhealthy").

provider.description: The SaaS provider that this Connection is for.

externalRef.description: The ID used by the provider to identify the app (optional).

provider.description: The SaaS provider that this app connects to.

clientId.description: The OAuth client ID for this app.

scopes.description: The OAuth scopes for this app.

createTime.description: The time the provider app was created.

updateTime.description: The time the provider app was updated.

groupRef.description: The ID of the user group that has access to this installation.

groupName.description: The name of the user group that has access to this installation.

createTime.description: The time the group was created.

updateTime.description: The time the group was last updated.

createTime.description: The time the consumer was created.

updateTime.description: The time the consumer was last updated.

providerWorkspaceRef.description: If available, the identifier for the provider workspace (e.g. the Salesforce subdomain)

providerConsumerRef.description: If available, the ID that Salesforce/Hubspot uses to identify this user (e.g. Salesforce has IDs in the form of https://login.salesforce.com/id/00D4x0000019CQTEA2/0054x000000orJ4AA)

createTime.description: The time the connection was created.

updateTime.description: The time the connection was last updated.

authScheme.description: The authentication scheme used for this connection.

status.description: The status of the connection.

accessToken.description: The access token for the connection.

refreshToken.description: The refresh token to use for the connection.

apiKey.description: The API key used while making the connection.

value.description: The value of the metadata field

source.description: The source of the metadata field

displayName.description: The human-readable name for the field

createTime.description: The time the integration was first installed.

createdBy.description: The person who did the installation, in the format of "consumer:{consumer-id}".

updateTime.description: The time the installation was last updated with a new config.

revisionId.description: The ID of the revision that this config is based on.

createTime.description: The time the config was created.

createdBy.description: The person who created the config, in the format of "consumer:{consumer-id}" or "builder:{builder-id}".

provider.description: The SaaS API that we are integrating with.

module.description: The SaaS module that we are integrating with.

objects.description: This is a map of object names to their configuration.

objectName.description: The name of the object to read from.

schedule.description: The schedule for reading the object, in cron syntax.

destination.description: The name of the destination that the result should be sent to.

selectedFields.description: This is a map of field names to booleans indicating whether they should be read. If a field is already included in `selectedFieldMappings`, it does not need to be included here.

selectedValueMappings.description: This is a map of field names to their value mappings.

additionalProperties.title: Selected Value Mappings
additionalProperties.description: This is a map of values to their mappings. The key is the value delivered to the webhook, the value is the value coming from the provider API.

selectedFieldMappings.description: This is a map of mapToNames to field names. (A mapTo name is the name the builder wants to map a field to when it lands in their destination.)

selectedFieldsAuto.title: Selected Fields Auto Config
selectedFieldsAuto.description: If selectedFieldsAuto is set to all, all fields will be read.

days.description: Number of days in past to backfill from. 0 is no backfill. e.g) if 10, then backfill last 10 days of data. Required if fullHistory is not set.

fullHistory.description: If true, backfill all history. Required if days is not set.

objects.description: This is a map of object names to their configuration.

objectName.description: The name of the object to write to.

selectedValueDefaults.description: This is a map of field names to default values. These values will be used when writing to the object.

value.description: The value to be used as a default.

applyOnUpdate.description:
Whether the default value should be applied when updating a record.
If set to `always`, the default value will be applied when updating a record.
If set to `never`, the default value will not be applied when updating a record,
only when creating a record.
If unspecified, then `always` is assumed.

value.description: The value to be used as a default.

applyOnUpdate.description:

only when creating a record.
If unspecified, then `always` is assumed.

allOf.title: Problem
allOf.description:
A Problem Details object (RFC 9457).

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

supportPhone.description: A phone number to contact for support

supportUrl.description: A URL to contact for support

retryable.description: Whether the request can be retried

retryAfter.description: A timestamp after which the request can be retried, formatted as RFC-3339

items.title: Input Validation Issue
items.description: An issue detected during input validation.

in.description: The location of the invalid input

name.description: The name of the invalid input

value.description: The value of the erroneous input

example.title: Bad Request
example.detail: The input message is incorrect

issues.title: Input isn't valid with respect to schema
issues.name: items[0].examplePropertyWithPattern

allOf.title: Problem
allOf.description:
A Problem Details object (RFC 9457).

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

supportPhone.description: A phone number to contact for support

supportUrl.description: A URL to contact for support

retryable.description: Whether the request can be retried

retryAfter.description: A timestamp after which the request can be retried, formatted as RFC-3339

items.title: Input Validation Issue
items.description: An issue detected during input validation.

allOf.title: Problem
allOf.description:
A Problem Details object (RFC 9457).

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

supportPhone.description: A phone number to contact for support

supportUrl.description: A URL to contact for support

retryable.description: Whether the request can be retried

retryAfter.description: A timestamp after which the request can be retried, formatted as RFC-3339

items.description: Fields to update. In case the mask is being used to update an object and the object's name contains special characters like a period, a forward slash or a colon, you must escape them using a backslash.

connectionId.description: The ID of the SaaS connection tied to this installation.

revisionId.description: The ID of the revision that this config is based on.

createdBy.description: The person who created the config, in the format of "consumer:{consumer-id}" or "builder:{builder-id}".

provider.description: The SaaS API that we are integrating with.

module.description: The SaaS module that we are integrating with.

objects.description: This is a map of object names to their configuration.

objectName.description: The name of the object to read from.

schedule.description: The schedule for reading the object, in cron syntax.

destination.description: The name of the destination that the result should be sent to.

selectedFields.description: This is a map of field names to booleans indicating whether they should be read. If a field is already included in `selectedFieldMappings`, it does not need to be included here.

selectedValueMappings.description: This is a map of field names to their value mappings.

additionalProperties.title: Selected Value Mappings
additionalProperties.description: This is a map of values to their mappings. The key is the value delivered to the webhook, the value is the value coming from the provider API.

selectedFieldMappings.description: This is a map of mapToNames to field names. (A mapTo name is the name the builder wants to map a field to when it lands in their destination.)

selectedFieldsAuto.title: Selected Fields Auto Config
selectedFieldsAuto.description: If selectedFieldsAuto is set to all, all fields will be read.

days.description: Number of days in past to backfill from. 0 is no backfill. e.g) if 10, then backfill last 10 days of data. Required if fullHistory is not set.

fullHistory.description: If true, backfill all history. Required if days is not set.

selectedValueDefaults.description: This is a map of field names to default values. These values will be used when writing to the object.

value.description: The value to be used as a default.

applyOnUpdate.description:
Whether the default value should be applied when updating a record.
If set to `always`, the default value will be applied when updating a record.
If set to `never`, the default value will not be applied when updating a record,
only when creating a record.
If unspecified, then `always` is assumed.

allOf.description:
A Problem Details object (RFC 9457).

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

supportPhone.description: A phone number to contact for support

supportUrl.description: A URL to contact for support

retryable.description: Whether the request can be retried

retryAfter.description: A timestamp after which the request can be retried, formatted as RFC-3339

get.description:
Retrieves metadata about an object in a customer's SaaS instance, including its fields.
This endpoint requires that an Installation exists for the given groupRef.
It applies object mappings.

parameters.name: projectIdOrName
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the project.

parameters.name: integrationId
parameters.description: The integration ID.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: Object name (mapped or unmapped)

parameters.name: groupRef
parameters.description: The groupRef for the installation

name.description: The provider name of the object

displayName.description: Human-readable name of the object

fields.description: Map of field metadata keyed by field name

fieldName.description: The name of the field from the provider API.

displayName.description: The display name of the field from the provider API.

providerType.description: Raw field type from the provider API.

values.description: If the valueType is singleSelect or multiSelect, this is a list of possible values

items.title: Field Value
items.description: Represents a field value

value.description: The internal value used by the system

allOf.description:

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

get.description:
Retrieves metadata about an object in a customer's SaaS instance, including its fields.
This endpoint only requires that a Connection exists for the given groupRef.
It does not apply any object mappings.

parameters.name: projectIdOrName
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the project.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The API Provider

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: Object name (mapped or unmapped)

parameters.name: groupRef
parameters.description: The groupRef for the connection.

name.description: The provider name of the object

displayName.description: Human-readable name of the object

fields.description: Map of field metadata keyed by field name

fieldName.description: The name of the field from the provider API.

displayName.description: The display name of the field from the provider API.

providerType.description: Raw field type from the provider API.

values.description: If the valueType is singleSelect or multiSelect, this is a list of possible values

items.title: Field Value
items.description: Represents a field value

value.description: The internal value used by the system

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

supportPhone.description: A phone number to contact for support

supportUrl.description: A URL to contact for support

retryable.description: Whether the request can be retried

retryAfter.description: A timestamp after which the request can be retried, formatted as RFC-3339

authType.title: Auth Type
authType.description: The type of authentication required by the provider.

baseURL.description: The base URL for making API requests.

oauth2Opts.title: OAuth2 Options
oauth2Opts.description: Configuration for OAuth2.0. Must be provided if authType is oauth2.

explicitScopesRequired.description: Whether scopes are required to be known ahead of the OAuth flow.

explicitWorkspaceRequired.description: Whether the workspace is required to be known ahead of the OAuth flow.

audience.description: A list of URLs that represent the audience for the token, which is needed for some client credential grant flows.

tokenMetadataFields.title: Token Metadata Fields
tokenMetadataFields.description: Fields to be used to extract token metadata from the token response.

otherFields.title: Token Metadata Fields - Other fields
otherFields.description: Additional fields to extract and transform from the token response

name.description: The internal name of the field

displayName.description: The human-readable name of the field

path.description: The path to the field in the token response (accepts dot notation for nested fields)

capture.description: A regex expression to capture the value that we need from the path. There must be only one capture group named 'result' in the expression. If not provided, will cause an error.

docsURL.description: URL with more information about where to retrieve Client ID and Client Secret, etc.

apiKeyOpts.title: API Key Options
apiKeyOpts.description: Configuration for API key. Must be provided if authType is apiKey.

attachmentType.description: How the API key should be attached to requests.

query.title: API Key Query Options
query.description: Configuration for API key in query parameter. Must be provided if type is in-query.

name.description: The name of the query parameter to be used for the API key.

header.title: API Key Header Options
header.description: Configuration for API key in header. Must be provided if type is in-header.

name.description: The name of the header to be used for the API key.

valuePrefix.description: The prefix to be added to the API key value when it is sent in the header.

docsURL.description: URL with more information about how to get or use an API key.

apiKeyAsBasic.description: If true, the provider uses an API key which then gets encoded as a basic auth user:pass string.

apiKeyAsBasicOpts.title: API Key as Basic Options
apiKeyAsBasicOpts.description: when this object is present, it means that this provider uses Basic Auth to actually collect an API key

fieldUsed.description: whether the API key should be used as the username or password.

keyFormat.description: How to transform the API key in to a basic auth user:pass string. The %s is replaced with the API key value.

docsURL.description: URL with more information about how to get or use an API key.

items.title: Custom Auth Header
items.description: A custom header to be used for authentication. Automatically added by the backend.

name.description: The name of the header.

valueTemplate.description: The value of the header, represented as a Golang text/template expression. Only the backend will interpret this.

headers.description: A list of custom headers to be used for authentication. The backend will add these headers.

items.title: Custom Auth Query Parameter
items.description: A custom query parameter to be used for authentication. Automatically added by the backend.

name.description: The name of the query parameter.

valueTemplate.description: The value of the query parameter, represented as a Golang text/template expression. Only the backend will interpret this.

queryParams.description: A list of custom query parameters to be used for authentication. The backend will add these query parameters.

items.title: Custom Auth Input
items.description: A custom input field for authentication. This is used by the frontend to dynamically render input fields for custom auth. The backend will not interpret this. It will however receive the value of this field before making a request (in the connection secrets).

name.description: The internal identifier for the custom auth input field.

displayName.description: The human-readable name for the custom auth input field.

prompt.example: See Authorization section of provider docs to obtain this value
prompt.description: Some helpful text or context to be displayed to the user when asking for this input.

docsURL.description: URL with details about this authentication mechanism and how to use it. Might be specific to this field, or a general URL for the provider. Optional.

inputs.description: A list of custom input fields for authentication. The frontend will render these input fields and the backend will receive the values of these fields before making a request.

support.title: Support
support.description: The supported features for the provider.

authHealthCheck.title: Auth Health Check
authHealthCheck.description: A URL to check the health of a provider's credentials. It's used to see if the credentials are valid and if the provider is reachable.

url.description: a no-op URL to check the health of the credentials. The URL MUST not mutate any state. If the provider doesn't have such an endpoint, then don't provide credentialsHealthCheck.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the health check. If not set, defaults to GET.

successStatusCodes.description: The HTTP status codes that indicate a successful health check. If not set, defaults to 200 and 204.

displayName.description: The display name of the provider, if omitted, defaults to provider name.

postAuthInfoNeeded.description: If true, we require additional information after auth to start making requests.

iconURL.description: URL to the icon for the provider.

logoURL.description: URL to the logo for the provider.

darkMode.title: Media Type Dark Mode
darkMode.description: Media to be used in dark mode.

iconURL.description: URL to the icon for the provider that is to be used in dark mode.

logoURL.description: URL to the logo for the provider that is to be used in dark mode.

targetURLScope.description: The scope of the target URL.

support.title: Support
support.description: The supported features for the provider.

metadata.title: Provider Metadata
metadata.description: Provider metadata that needs to be given by the user or fetched by the connector post authentication for the connector to work.

name.description: The internal identifier for the metadata field

displayName.description: The human-readable name for the field

defaultValue.description: Default value for this metadata item

docsURL.description: URL with more information about how to locate this value

moduleDependencies.description: Module-specific dependencies for this metadata item.
moduleDependencies.title: Module Dependencies

additionalProperties.title: Module Dependency
additionalProperties.description: Dependency for a single module.

postAuthentication.description: Metadata fetched by the connector post authentication

name.description: The internal identifier for the metadata field

moduleDependencies.description: Module-specific dependencies for this metadata item.
moduleDependencies.title: Module Dependencies

additionalProperties.title: Module Dependency
additionalProperties.description: Dependency for a single module.

A Problem Details object (RFC 9457).

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

parameters.name: includeCreds
parameters.description: Whether to include the credentials in the response. Only access token will be included. Default is false.

parameters.name: includeRefreshToken
parameters.description: Whether to include the refresh token in credentials in the response along with access token. If true, the `includeCreds` query parameter will be ignored. Default is false.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: Whether to refresh the access token. If value is `ifExpired`, the access token will be refreshed only if it has expired. If value is `force`, the access token will be refreshed regardless of its expiration.

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem

mapToName.description: An object name to map to.

mapToDisplayName.description: A display name to map to.

mapToName.description: The field name to map to.

mapToDisplayName.description: The display name to map to.

mapToName.description: The field name to map to.

mapToDisplayName.description: The display name to map to.

days.description: Number of days in past to backfill from. 0 is no backfill. e.g) if 10, then backfill last 10 days of data. Required if fullHistory is not set.

fullHistory.description: If true, backfill all history. Required if days is not set.

mode.description: The data delivery mode for this object. If not specified, defaults to automatic.

pageSize.description: The number of records to receive per data delivery.

inheritMapping.description: If true, the write object will inherit the mapping from the read object. If false, the write object will have no mapping.

valueDefaults.title: Value Defaults
valueDefaults.description: Configuration to set default write values for object fields.

allowAnyFields.description: If true, users can set default values for any field.

inheritFieldsAndMapping.description: If true, the integration will inherit the fields and mapping from the read object.
